title: BabyBandit
author: BabyBandit
content: Hey. What's your pro's & con's with Windows 11? When I woke up today I noticed my computer had automatic updated and installed Win 11 from last night when I just clicked "Download and update then shut down the computer"-button.First I was like "Oh no.." I have been pushed this forwards a long time, but the omputer seems to run much smoother and faster, it's actually a quite big difference. So I am very pleased and I don't have a super good computer only 16GB RAM on my Windows computer.Pro's - Windows 11 is faster than Windows 10. However, some users is experiencing slow performance issue due to low disk storage or outdated drivers. Don't worry. It can be fixed easily- Windows 11 has better optimization and lower memory usage compared to Windows 10, with fewer system errors and no critical errors on either system.Con's - Windows 11 has fewer customization options compared to Windows 10. This may not be suitable for users who prefer a more personalized operating system. Windows 11 has removed the Control Panel, which was present in Windows 10. This may be frustrating for users who prefer the Control Panel over the Settings app.I am sure.. I missed a bunch of other's pro's and con's, whats your pro's and con's regarding Win 11?

However, some users is experiencing slow performance issue due to low disk storage or outdated drivers. Don't worry. It can be fixed easilyThe latter one should have been a cons. And most of the people that have years of potato PC won't upgrade to 11 because of this. It is not just fit and compatible to the hardware that we've got and it's not just all about having low disk space and drivers.But also the compatibility of the hardware itself like MOBO. It's nice if you can upgrade to that because all of us will eventually go there somewhere in the future because there's nowhere to go but to adopt the new version of windows.

comments.author: mich
comments.body: Well everytime I put on my laptop there is updates that Windows 11 does want to do. It bothers me so much it made me disable automatic updates. I can notice the difference in speeds for 10 and 11. It is the reason I made the upgrade when Windows 11 came out a few years ago.

comments.author: NotFuzzyWarm
comments.body: QuoteWhat is MOBO? You lost me there bro. MOBO is short for MOtherBOard. More specifically, it relates to the CPU and the support chips (eg Southbridge chip) along with the BIOS on it.

comments.author: John93r8t
comments.body: I've only ever used Windows 11 in my VirtualMachine to play around with it. My current Windows PC apparently doesn't meet the requirements for upgrading. Being inside a VM and not a dedicated PC, this probably affects the performance quality quite a bit. But, incidentally, I've noticed Windows 10 is pretty fast too provided you kill all the unnecessary baggage that starts on boot in the task manager. The fact Windows 11 is better by default might suggest it's shipping with less bloat. My most major con though is the fact it's just a "black box" operating system. I prefer running Open Source wherever and whenever possible.

comments.author: woodsandhillsplc
comments.body: I Windows 11 is fine once you get used to it. You can customise it enough such that anything you miss from Windows 10 can be tweaked back to how you had it, eg the taskbar.
